name: NBCNews
text: LIVE on @NBCNewsNOW: Craig Melvin hosts 'Growing Up Black', a conversation with families on the realities of parenting Black children in America. https://t.co/dxmftysYff

name: NBCNews
text:
RT @NBCNewsNow: Growing up Black: Families Confronting Racism

Join @craigmelvin for this important conversation

name: NBCNews
text: In a matter of weeks, Black Lives Matter activists went from struggling to get a response from the L.A. City Council on defunding the police to presenting their budget demands in person. https://t.co/0VUqjyCfIU

name: NBCNews
text:
RT @NBCNewsNow: She always buoyed that with 'I am somebody'

She'd say: "I am"

And I would say: "Somebody"

@trymainelee discusses his mother with @craigmelvin in our special report - Growing Up Black: Families Confronting Racism

Watch right NOW: https://t.co/U4UZMHn7bF (and replay at 11pmET) https://t.co/JTBfRrXji0

name: NBCNews
text:
RT @NBCNewsNow: "We shouldn't be fighting the same war that our grandmothers had to fight - that our great grandmothers had to fight."

Please tune in to our conversation about race and family with @craigmelvin - Growing Up Black

Watch NOW: https://t.co/U4UZMHn7bF (and replay at 11pmET) https://t.co/CBQrC0QUEk

name: NBCNews
text: Democratic Colorado Senate hopeful John Hickenlooper apologizes for comments he made 6 years ago comparing politicians to slaves being whipped to row “an ancient slave ship.” https://t.co/oxj7fDgXgf

name: NBCNews
text: The bodies of a missing protester and an AARP volunteer were found over the weekend in Tallahassee, Florida, authorities say. A suspect in their disappearances has been taken into custody. https://t.co/ov7KfH3QQ2

text: The order would create a database to track police misconduct and include language encouraging police to involve mental health professionals when dealing with homelessness, mental illness and addiction issues. https://t.co/EzQnXcSPKQ

text: ABC News says it has placed one of its top executives on administrative leave as accusations of racial prejudice continue to roil the top echelons of the media industry in the wake of the death of George Floyd. https://t.co/ZTG6Sk5u9K

text: "The LGBT community was panic-stricken that the retirement of their hero, Justice Kennedy, would cause them to suffer a huge setback in the Supreme Court. Instead, it's a massive victory," SCOTUSblog publisher Tom Goldstein says. https://t.co/IR7rUCRcD7
